page.title: 20PUDSEY PARK
page.content: Pudsey Park was opened at the end of the 19th century.In those days there was a lake and a bandstand and on Sunday evenings thousands of local people and visitors would gather there.Today it does not attract thousands but it is still a popular spot.The bowling greens are used almost all the year round by young and old alike.There are beautiful trees, flower-beds,greenhouses,an aviary and a miniature zoo is being built at the present time. One of the most popular spots is the children's playground,opened in 1937 to commemorate the coronation of George VI.There are swings,slides,a climbing frame,a see-saw and a genuine steam-roller.The park is at its most beautiful in springtime when the flowering cherry trees lining all the paths are in full bloom.
